title: REA Group, Singapore's 99.co start south-east Asian 'proptech' giant
text:
Aside from Sequoia and Mr Saverin, other founding partners of 99.co including Allianz X, MindWorks Ventures, East Ventures and 500 Startups will also invest in the new joint venture. Together they will own 73 per cent of the company.

REA Group separately will be the largest shareholder of the joint venture at 27 per cent. It will also contribute $US8 million ($11.9 million) in working capital to the new business.

'Ripe for disruption'

"The Singapore marketplace is ripe for disruption," said Owen Wilson, REA Group chief executive. "Our customers in this market want a true industry partner who can deliver world-leading products and experiences.

"Joining forces with 99.co creates the market-leading presence in terms of customers and listings."

"Combined with our expertise and experience in other countries where we are the clear market leader, this presents a fantastic opportunity to rapidly increase our market share in these expanding growth markets.”

99.co chief executive Darius Cheung will head up the joint venture while REA Asia chief executive Henry Ruiz and REA Group chief financial officer Janelle Hopkins will represent REA Group’s interests as non-executive directors.

Advertisement

Mr Cheung's appointment was a reflection of his leadership at 99.co, which now has a user base 32 times larger than it was two years ago, Mr Ruiz said.

REA Asia boss Henry Ruiz. Supplied

"Over the past two years we’ve admired the innovation and speed that Darius and his team have brought to the marketplaces that they serve," Mr Ruiz said.

Before 99.co, Cheung co-founded Singaporean mobile security start-up tenCube in 2005, later acquired by McAfee.

"Our JV company sets the scene for us to create the number one place for property seekers in Singapore and Indonesia," Mr Cheung said.

The transaction is subject to a further due diligence scheduled to complete later this year, with the new joint venture and portal set to go live across Singapore and Indonesia in early 2020.
description: Sequoia and Facebook co-founder Eduardo Saverin have also backed the new JV by REA Group and Singapore property portal 99.co.
